intro: Bahiopsis parishii, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are small, gray-green, and covered in a fine layer of white hairs to reduce water loss. Bahiopsis parishii is well adapted to hot, dry conditions and is often found in rocky soils and desert plains.
